title: Afshin Chavoshi
text:
Seyyed Reza "Afshin" Chavoshi (born 17 September 1984, <a href="Rasht">Rasht</a>) is an Iranian football player of <a href="Damash%20Gilan">Damash Gilan</a>. He plays as a <a href="Striker%20%28football%29">Striker</a>.
Club career.
In 2001, he was called up to <a href="Esteghlal%20Rasht">Esteghlal Rasht</a> from the youth team by <a href="Nasser%20Hejazi">Nasser Hejazi</a> when he was 17 years old. Chavoshi scored his first goal in <a href="Iran%20Pro%20League">Iran Pro League</a> in 2–0 win over <a href="F.C.%20Aboomoslem">Aboomoslem</a> in the same season. The following season relegating to <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a> and dissolution of Esteghlal Rasht he played next season in a new team <a href="Pegah%20Gilan%20F.C.">Pegah</a>. He was transferred to <a href="Malavan">Malavan</a> in <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20Azadegan%20League">2003–04</a> season because of army services but didn't play a single game due injury. He returned to Pegah in 2004 and continued his career with this team until October 2008 when Pegah was sold to Damash Iranian (Damash Mineral Water Company) due financial problems and Chavohsi played in a new team <a href="Damash%20Gilan%20F.C.">Damash Gilan</a> in 2009–10 season. He had very good time with Damash In <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Iran%20Pro%20League">2009–10 season</a> he scored 15 goals and became the 4th best goal-scorer of the league but Despite having a good season and score many goals, Damash was relegated to first division and Chavoshi was transferred to <a href="Steel%20Azin%20F.C.">Steel Azin</a>. After playing one season at Steel Azin he moved back to Damash in 2010 and help the team to promote back to <a href="Iran%20Pro%20League">Iran Pro League</a> he also became top goal scorer of <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Azadegan%20League%23Top%20scorers.2C%20Group%20A">season</a>. On last days of December 2013 he made a 3 months deal with <a href="Aluminium%20Hormozgan%20F.C.">Aluminium</a> until end of <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Azadegan%20League">2013–14 Azadegan League</a>.
Famous match.
On April 11, 2008 he played one of his memorial matches for Pegah against <a href="Esteghlal%20Tehran">Esteghlal Tehran</a> in <a href="Azadi%20Stadium">Azadi Stadium</a> which he scored and assist twice. Pegah was able to beat Esteghlal 4 to 1 and this is one of the worst lost in Esteghlal's club history.
International career.
In 2005, he was called up for <a href="Iran%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Iran national under-23 football team</a>.
